HaF_XZCsHrmjGdb8TlytWw.text: Very good food. Looking for health fair,  then this is a good way to go. Fragrant Indian spices add to the experience.  I don't do many (2) reviews, but feel compelled to put in a good word for people who strive to provide a good service.

j9l6LkQEUWVnJLgFxdIi1A.text: Been here a few times for lunch.  Quality food, great flavors and taste.  I like the Chicken and Lamb Thali lunch platters.  The Kati rolls (packaged like a burrito) are good as well.  Definitely need to come back for dinner.

r5zFn2n9YxNSM34p-6sqPA.text: Wonderful food, excellent service, a real treat if you are fond of Indian food.  The staff is very good about making sure that you are clear on the different levels of "hot curry."  The lunch "sampler" is really good and gives one a great idea of the variety of this cuisine.  A definte "keeper"

ajQ3R2Sk2WwLaABopHFYHA.text: Food was very good and for a good price! It was also nice to sit outside. They had some good menu options! The staff was slightly off, but they were friendly and didn't bug us when we stayed late.

ucF1jo8AhO6oR-Qg2vw-lQ.text: Unbelievable food, service, and a great experience. Highly highly recommend coming by marigold ASAP. Even if you don't have time, grab food to go.

lTOpndLW-YNMfBHddqOmvQ.text: I have finally found very good Indian cuisine in Phoenix. The food and service were excellent. The portion sizes are very substantial. I have had the Samosas and Chicken Korma two times and would recommend them.

MgYo5XjAA5Sn-QNw1ez2GA.text: We had a wonderful dinner tonight.  Delicious food including chicken curry and lamb vindaloo.  Spice level was medium plus.  The service was so attentive and sincere.  Abraham and Gina were great.  We look forward to our next visit!

u2xky7DVC0KSHJm_LpETjQ.text: I was amazed with my experience here. My girlfriend orders the lamb chicken Marsala and I had the chicken Vindaloo. Well her lamb was delicious and my chicken was sub par, so naturally I ate all of hers. The waitress noticed my untouched plate and comped it off the bill and offered to make me something else. I will definitely give this place another chance

03j_MthAeU77ckkFQaV60A.text: This restaurant has the best quality indian food in AZ hands down! I highly recommend their chicken biriyani, out of all the different places I have tried this dish, this is the best I've ever had. If you're in the area, definitely stop by. You won't be disappointed.

lRiXtiuv_s_4ofAxRY8wEw.text: I've been here 3-5 times now.  Same owners as Roka Akor, one of my all time favorite restaurants, so you know that quality is going to be there as they settle for nothing but the best.  Very casual and quite atmosphere.  Service is fast and friendly.  Food is flavorful and has depth to it.  You can go no heat to quite hot.  Severs are good about explaining the dishes and levels of heat, flavors, etc.    Give this place a shot if you like Indian Food or aren't sure if you do because they will make you a believer!

2m96k-hY9Kl3VtN0Js9_Vw.text: We had a great family experience at Marigold Maison.  The naan was outstanding.  The chicken dishes were superbly prepared.  Just the right amount of seasoning and delicious.  The service was also excellent.  The server was attentive and very knowledgeable.  This was an outstanding dining event.

njZU3lRXRLIhbN7kMJ-wCg.text: Accommodating. Friendly. Professional. Delicious. This was a wonderful experience in True Indian cuisine. A must try and an asset to Scottsdale.

CauqMbuotmm-kh3AIfSwNg.text: Best Indian food I've had yet! Small, quaint restaurant but very friendly staff and delightfully delicious dishes.

uZmdknT7wSLSgUzWwNVLMA.text: Best Indian food! Fantastic service. The scallops melted in my mouth. If you haven't been here, stop in immediately.

0moE3GYanhhFQ75PTKGIvw.text: Amazing service and food! The manager is always really friendly, the servers are nice, and this place has great Indian food (coming from someone who was raised on Indian cooking) I highly suggest this place to anyone looking for a great Indian, dining experience. The place is a bit small but they're expanding very soon!

vhpp_y_3O0U0VwOhompzkg.text: A nice addition to the hood. Food is flavorful. Ambiance and decor is lovely. Great service. Loved the lamb chop tandoori.

jiL-os9ymngd9LuuIc6Zmw.text: We love this place. If we are craving for an Indian food, this place is our go to restaurant. Food is palatable and the service is always excellent. The staff are always knowledgeable and helpful if you don't know what to eat or order. They'll give you suggestions on what to eat and etc.

ekykA0SIW4NbPLrc7rSa_w.text: Love Love Love this place!!! Go for lunch though, not dinner. They raise the prices and it's the same food!?! The menu price has also in erased in the last year. The service and food are amazing though!!!

jCe9t9MmdHZwfTgnBMAlOg.text: Completely worth the drive from the East Valley!  One of our good friends recommended this place, so my wife and I had to try it. We consider ourselves Indian food snobs... Let's start by saying the service was fast and friendly. We had an awesome waitress named Pushpa who took great care of us.  I had the mango lassie and chicken tikka masala. The lassie was soooo smooth and delicious I could seriously go back just for it.  The chicken tikka was amazing too. I ordered it "Indian Spicy" and all though that wasn't really quite spicy enough for me, it still tasted delicious. Pushpa brought out some additional chili past to allow me to heat things up even more!!!  Oh! I almost forgot, we had the samosa's for an appetizer... WOW! so delicious.  My wife had chicken saag, she thought it tasted great as well.  Overall, I'd make the 30+ miles drive again just to come to this restaurant...

VFVoGJL60ubfcHR3ncFRCw.text: I have to tell you from the moment I walked in the smell was just amazing and I could not wait to taste the food.   Bathrooms were family style and very clean.  Our waitress was very nice! She got the water no ice rught the first try and the water was filtered and cold, perfect for a hot day.    We ordered the Hyderabad and Tikka Masada and they were the perfect temperature, spice and we're very tasty.  Overall one of the best dinner adventures we have had. Stop what your doing and makes reservations if you want to impress your someone with a great meal for a great price.

My favorite dish here is the vindaloo with lamb! Perfectly spicy, with explosive flavors, and lamb that melts in your mouth. For a comfort dish, order chicken tikka masala...but honestly, I've never tried anything I didn't like here.

I ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and the color of the Masala looked like light brown dog food.  The taste was super bland and I could only eat about one third of the meal before throwing it out.  The chicken was dry, chewy and far from any kind of tenderness. We also had the Chicken Tikka and the chicken was also the same, hard and chewy. Super disappointing meal!

The portions are generous and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be trying the curry next!    And try the mango lassi, sooo yummy!

h6PFzRok5wJUFe54hQmmNA.text: I know of a great Indian place in northern ca. (Naan & curry in concord ca) ever since I moved out to Arizona one of my missions is to find delicious Indian food. The chicken tika masala is perfect, its not clumpy, the flavor isn't just heat, but actual flavor.. haha get me? In comparison to naan & curry no place was cutting it... Till I found this place. I live quite a ways away but this place is so worth it. So delicious ... Oh and I love how their naan is fluffy and not all thin and crispy.. Another important aspect! Yum yum I'm writing this at 2 am and am super sad they're not open late night ._.also only sad part is they're double the price. :( @ naan & curry I got my chicken tikka masala, two naans, and rice for 13 bucks! Here its like 30 :( but until I find that hole in the wall with great pricing.. I'll be going here :_:

0RLn_8ual2sBoHmzbNGGtQ.text: Love the food here ... It's very pricey for the quantity they serve... But the food tastes great and has no artificial addons to it ... Tastes like home cooked food ..: only if they were cheaper for the very less quantity of the food they serve ..  Had veg thali, okra curry, veg biryani and mango lassi... All of them were awesome..

xlW_ZZtPZIih8TTHKMMC1Q.text: Four of us enjoyed multiple dishes. Each one was delicious and the service was excellent. Our server Pushpa and Abraham were welcoming, knowledgeable and professional. Marigold Maison is a neighborhood treasure. Thanks. We will return soon.

lXgu6yVDXTWhVDU8Sum1NA.text: This is the best tikka misala I 've ever tried!!! I would eat it ever day if I could. I usually eat it with the delicious garlic naan with butter. Highly recommended it! For desert I get the rice pudding. This place is True hidden gem.

pr8XRc-oKmf2HQTX19jzhA.text: I have now dined here 4 times so I feel qualified to give an expert review. Hands down the best indian I've had in the valley. I absolutely love the Flavors. We ask for ours extra spicy but they still make a great mild for all of the wimps out there. What I like most is the meat in each dish is quality.   Service is excellent they really take care of you while you are here and every single person we've had is very friendly and accommodating.   I also like that the restaurant feels clean and fresh. No dark corner booths with ripped vinyl in sight.   My only complaint is they are closed next week for their expansion. Congrats to them for being successful but how are we supposed to survive without it for a whole week? I guess we will manage. Can't wait to see it when it's finished.

XDEqD0-128LDqsMBLO8vGQ.text: Food was good and flavorful. The rice was naan was excellent. The price for the food is on the high side for Indian food compared to the local area. Nice dinning atmosphere.

pzrFQEaOwt_NDCwD7aeuBg.text: From the second I walked in the door I was amazed at the service and atmosphere. The manager was so kind and helpful with making sure we were having a great experience. Our waitress was very sweet. The place smelt incredible and normally I can't eat in an Indian restaurant best of the smells being so strong.   The food- If your looking for the perfect family style night out this is the place. We tried three different chicken dishes and all were beyond any Indian food I've ever had. The spices tasted fresh and full of the perfect flavor. It was honestly hard to stop eating because the portion sizes are large.  Cocktails- whom ever their bar tender is they make one amazing martini!    Will be returning here again!

ROtk4k8YcXbKO6qzhdj0Pg.text: Definitely never going there again. Very in-authentic Indian catering to the folks who have probably never tried Indian food. Kanji lemonade - not only had no kanji, it had no fresh squeezed lemon. it was just Hi-c.  Samosas were soooo bland and made from tortilla. Garlic naan was cold, burnt - how can one mess up on naan?!  Ordered spicy version of saag paneer - same bland taste as other mild dishes. Achar was dry and old. All in all - complete waste of money, time and taste.

2PFgXHulg-kAOslZiPlCPg.text: I learned about this place when they offered a "lunch only" Groupon.  When I looked them up I realized they were located at the same address Bombay Spice had recently relocated to in 2014, which means Bombay didn't even last a year.  I went there for lunch yesterday.  Both the waiter and General Manager were very nice and answered several questions.    I learned that Marigold is owned by the same corporation (JNK Concepts) that owned Bombay.  They have the same chef, but completely different food, menu and pricing.  JNK has multiple restaurants primarily in Phoenix and Chicago.  They also own Roka Akor and Nobuo here in the Phoenix area and still have one Bombay Spice in downtown Chicago.  The restaurant has been upgraded slightly.  You no longer order your food at the counter; they have wait staff.  The prices are considerably higher.  I told both the waiter and GM that I'd not been there before and wanted to be impressed, so asked them what they would suggest, indicating that I was thinking of ordering one of their Thali dishes.  They recommended that I try one of two other dishes which weren't on the lunch menu, but their dinner menu.  I seldom order Dosa because they are usually vegetarian, which I'm not, but I decided to give it a try.  In addition, I specifically wanted to taste their Naan.  There Dosa is called "Masala Dosa" which is a crepe filled with potato and onion.  It is served with two sides; Coconut Chutney (the larger bowl) and Sambar.  The crepe looked massive on the plate when it was served, however half of it was filled - the rest was just empty crepe.  The Coconut Chutney was very good, but I wished it had been spicier and there had been more of it.  The filling was OK, but not terrific, however you have to keep in mind, I'm not a vegetarian.  There was very little spice, and in my opinion, taste, in the filling.  There Naan bread was very good, but not the best I've had at some nearby Indian restaurants.  Their service was excellent and the GM was very helpful.  I left with mixed emotions.  The food was good, but I was not as blown away as others appear to be.  I'm sure they use good ingredients and it was well prepared, but to me lacked the kick and taste I would have preferred.  The killer was their prices; considerably higher than most Indian restaurants.    This Dosa and Naan came to $14.  I'm not a big eater, but the Dosa without the Naan would not have filled me.  Without a coupon I wouldn't go back and pay $14 for what I had.  It probably isn't fair to compare their prices with other places because they claim their meat and fish are a far better quality, and I haven't tried them, but I frequently get either a meat or seafood masala/curry, and Marigold's prices are 25-70% more.  Without additional coupons it is unlikely I'd return, based on price alone.  Their food to me wasn't "that" special.  I'm giving them a 3-star overall, but believe their food probably deserves a 4-star, although not for me based on what I had.

F-U4-J0sh7X88oGleCteKA.text: Not realy indian food. The idea is pretty, the interior is pretty... the wait staff is nice... but the food is awful... the mango lasse and the chai were really bad. All of the curries were so liquidy...

SPBGm9kmsTG_hshQN8wcng.text: You want to make reservations if going on a Friday or Saturday night.   The food is pricey.  The ambience is pleasant.   I ordered the Malai Kofta. The spice is a bit bland. The dumplings were pretty tasty, even if the sp car is bland.   Another person in my party Tandori Sampler. It was also bland and expensive   The third person ordered the Makhana. This person likes bland food much more than the rest of the party and raved about it.   We had garlic naan and paneer naan and a veggie Samosa. The best part of the dinner was the naan. But I prefer Indian restaurants that keep the naan coming with meals.   It isn't bad to eat here considering you are in PV, and there really isn't much culture there. No shortage of upper middle class white people lining up to eat here.

bFLjdm3U4xQf5KYIDvHSvg.text: I CANNOT say enough about this place  The first and only restaurant I've ever enjoyed Indian cuisine at, and I doubt I'll go anywhere else. I always bring my friends who have never tried this food and everyone loves it. The atmosphere is great, the drinks are amazing and the service is even better. The owners and staff are so helpful with their guidance, you are guaranteed to love whatever you get. Go there today!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Had a wonderful time for a girls dinner!!

gvIvOTvgbKBZU5wVUcrihg.text: I initially was displeased with both the service and quality of food. Let's just say I'd pretty much written the place off. However, Sharon, a member of management invited us back to give them a second try.  I must say I was pleasantly surprised at the turnaround. From the moment we walked in the door we were greeted by the friendly bartender and seated at a table with a great view of the artwork. Out came out drinks with a pair of samosas. I knew we'd made the right choice to return. Every item on our lunch platter was delicious and flavorful.   My favorite items were the chicken masala, samosas and lentil soup. Please try all of the chutneys and sauces! As someone who has lived in India for several months on a work assignment, I can be a naan snob. Marigold Maison's was buttery goodness perfect for absorbing all the flavors bestowed upon us.  Not only will I be back but I'll spread the word. Thank you again Sharon for the great service and lunch!

yOlRfj-Ayx4TxdtHcjqUXA.text: This place has great chicken tikka masala - actually it's the best! This time I ordered the tandoori chicken as well. It was different than what I've had at other places. It was good- just different than what I've had other places. Garlic naan - yes please. Hummus was a little bland, but taste fresh which I definitely appreciate. The wings were not as crispy as I prefer. I'm not sure if I'd order them again.

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tandoori chicken

3_VNvtyztu2pTWktP0m0rw.text: Since we were suddenly craving Indian food we decided to take the family to check out Marigold Maison. It feels small but there was plenty of seating inside and out. We opted for in and were quickly seated and drink orders taken.  I always associate Indian food with Taj Mahal beer and we were able to start this meal off right with the perfect drink for a hot summer night! We ordered two of the chicken pakora appetizers and changed our minds when our waitress pointed out that the serving was generous. It was ample enough for the four of us. The naan (both plain and onion) was superb--perfect for sopping up sauces. I always order chicken korma when trying any new Indian restaurant. Because it is a favorite, I always have plenty of other establishments to compare it to. The dish arrived with a LOT of chicken in a delicious, creamy sauce. As stated on the menu, there were also pieces of fruit (possibly mango) in the sauce, which is something I had not experienced with this dish before. The portions and quality of all our meals were excellent. I admit to being a wimp and am not big on very spicy food, but I do like flavor. The general consensus was that the dishes were slightly on the bland side--not just in the level of spiciness (there was no heat) but just lacking the usual Indian spices. Service was attentive and, if we were going immediately home, we would have taken the leftovers. Would we go back again--yes!

7XEHvZWNXuyc0Ifm2W00vA.text: According to various colleagues both India based and phoenix based this is probably one of the best Indian cuisine choices in the area.   I thought this was a real solid meal. Plenty of breads represented i was a bit sad they don't offer poori.    Overall it did stack up nice vs say some joints i goto back in NY in little india streets in the east village or curry hill.

wQU5rgPuBF1G1xNVDwQjOw.text: We came for restaurant week and their $33 dinner included either an all-you-can-eat Traditional (has meat) or Vegetarian Thali Platter. We tried both because variety is the spice of life!   The traditional platter consisted of shrimp tikka (grilled), lamb curry, chicken masala, and malai kofta (veggie cheese dumplings). The vegetarian platter consisted of chana masala (chickpea curry), saag paneer (spinach with cheese), malai kofta and paneer tikka (grilled cheese). Both platters also came with unlimited sides including: samosa, naan (you can also request garlic naan with no additional charge), papadum chips, basmati rice, lentil soup, quinoa salad, and rice pudding. The staff was incredibly attentive and kind. They were constantly refilling our dishes and water.  Everything was so delicious, very authentic and fresh! My favorite was the shrimp tikka, they definitely do not skimp on the shrimps, they're large and very succulent! I was also excited to learn that they would start having these all-you-can-eat platters every weekend!

dmgMBE54iy5hkkaNaXVZlg.text: We ordered takeout from Marigold Masion through  yelp fulfilled by Grubhub.  One of the item (Biryani) was burnt and was inedible. I contacted Grubhub and gave them the feedback and asked the refund for that item. Both Marigold Maison and Grubhub have the poor customer service ever. Grubhub associate tells me that he called the restaurant and gave them the feedback and requested the refund but the restaurant tells him that they can't refund. This restaurant food ain't cheap and to receive such a horrible food is disappointing. And the worst part is the restaurant customer service is extremely unprofessional. I will never order taker outs through yelp/ Grubhub again and will not recommend this restaurant to anyone. Horrible tasting food.

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burnt Biryani- Marigold Maison

IXCRGBYFVWnqWcHEP3V_Lg.text: Need to get a lunch buffet....although they have something similar where they bring a tasting plate. Didnt love most of those things.

3cFatN2WvfEIBq4zpDElhw.text: This place made the best Paneer tikka masala, rice, and samosas. Love the sweet chutney. Hats off to the chefs tonight. The food also tasted very fresh. Great Friday night meal to start my weekend(: simple the best around

zRDmDQEcgLRbgTYUdXwbaQ.text: This place is down the street from our house but I've only eaten there once before. I enjoyed it my first time but haven't gone back because my fiance is not a fan of Indian food. With him gone Saturday night and a few glasses of wine in me, I decided to order takeout with UberEats.   My order: samosas, chicken tikka, garlic naan, rice. My total: $38.83 ($2.99 delivery included).   The samosas were my favorite part of my order. When I ordered them, I was afraid they might get soggy on the ride to my house but they were still crisp and so flavorful. If you can't handle a lot of spices, I would advise to to not get these. If you enjoy a lot of flavor, these are a great appetizer for you.   The garlic naan didn't really taste much like garlic. The garlic is visible but the taste was bland. It was just okay.   I was not impressed with the chicken tikka and it is probably because I don't like anything burnt. There were parts of the chicken that were pretty dark and overcooked so I threw out some of it. The dish was a safe one for me and I was not a fan. Where was the flavor?  Maybe it's because I'm Asian but I enjoy eating flavorful dishes with rice. I noticed that my entree wouldn't come with rice but I really didn't want to whip any up myself. The cost for a side of rice: $4. I would say that is a little much - especially for the portion. I guess I was paying for the convenience.  I was a bit disappointed but was able to enjoy some of it. I felt like it was a bit overpriced as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Samosas
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken tikka
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic naan, samosas (front middle), rice (back), chicken tikka.

IGZY0SuAP-AF77a5NnCzcA.text: Ridiculously amazing food that isn't overpriced. Lunch is an incredible meal deal, along with quick friendly service. Dinner is more intimate to me with servings enough to share family style. Start off with the pakora and naan breads. Currently they are offering all-you-can-eat Thali platters!!!! This is great because you get to sample many of their great selections, especially the lamb masala and lamb vindaloo. Lamb Biriyani is another classic fave of mine. Vegan choices are also available but you know I couldn't speak on that. I discovered the mango lassi and can drink a pitcher of it; refreshing and the perfect accompaniment to the spicy dishes. The small wine selection offers plenty to pair with your dish choices. I love to finish off with the dessert and suggest asking for the ras malai. It's not on the menu but you'll love it! Take out is available and you can sit at the bar to check out the wonderful patrons that flock here.  I keep pretty great company when it comes to food. Check out the other reviewers, most of them are my friends. To give credit where it is due, I followed a dear friend and fellow Yelper Jonathan L.'s suggestion and embarked on a deeper appreciation for Indian food. You will find no better place to explore that than here. You know you can't venture too wrong if you bring a vegan Indian friend and they gush about the food right?!!

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I am not the type of person that turns away food especially if it&#39;s lamb biriyani and samosa.
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I eat lamb biriyani because someone is running on a treadmill somewhere. Support is imperative.
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A balanced diet is having dessert. Never turn down ras malai, pure condensed milk goodness.

n_zbYzRN_Ubyc2T7U5ohtA.text: Love this place, especially all you can eat thalia platters.  Not a big fan of veg thali as spices level is pretty low making it taste bland. Love thali concept as that's just how we get in India as we don't have buffet concept. Great thing about this place everything in thali is unlimited no exclusions. My husband loved the lamb curry and we enjoyed samosa with amazing mint chutney and tamarind chutney. Service was really good. Loved it.

qm88HkGmecSVPGAOizZbjQ.text: Had a phenomenal first experience at Marigold Maison today! We had a good appetizer(like a salad with salmon and shrimp) but the showstoppers were the Makhani Chicken and the Garlic Naan, WOW! I'm not one to step this far outside my box but I'm so glad I did. I'll definitely be back very soon, can't wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wZ-rrAuVbvFAePc0kgzBrQ.text: I came here for their restaurant week special.   We got all you can eat Taste of India platter which included samosa, mango salad, shrimp tikka, chicken tilka masala, lamb curry, malai kofta, naan, basmati rice, and galub jaman (doughnut like dessert). This was all for $33 a person. It was quite a bit of food surprisingly. I only had a second helping of the shrimp and chicken masala.   The malai kofta sauce was delicious! The dumpling it self was interesting- not for me personally. Everyone was nice and service was speedy!

AvmxziTkrJgtQKf2pg1Jqw.text: Very authentic flavors.  Staff is very friendly.  The Gobi Manchurian is very spicy, just the way it should be.  Other favorite dishes are Chana Masala, Goan Vindaloo and the Biryani.

S7N4n-v_Hju2TUHBJJaTzg.text: Decided at the last minute to check out Marigold Maison on Wednesday and I'm so glad we did! The restaurant is in a strip mall near Paradise Valley Mall. When you walk in, I instantly noticed a couple things, the cleanliness of the restaurant and the smells, AMAZING smells coming from the open kitchen.  We were seated right away.   We started off with the garlic naan. It was good, I mean, really good, we ended up ordering another one. Best 3 bucks you can spend!  Wife got the Chicken Tikka Masala served with Basmati rice. It was rich and the chicken was tender, I loved it, yes, I ate some of her food. Don't worry, I shared mine with her.  I got the lamb chops. They were perfectly cooked. Tender, melt in your mouth deliciousness. It came with a mango salad, full of raisins, assorted nuts, it was awesome.   So stoked that we took a little drive to this restaurant. Service was on point, super clean restaurant, appreciated seeing the manager walk the restaurant and check out the tables to make sure everyone was o.k. Super awesome service.  WE WILL BE BACK!  Oh, they have Happy Hour (food) but you have to sit at the bar or patio for it. They do offer Happy Hour (just alcohol) if you're in the dining room.

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1yJl0Z5uWIwXXgdbrMusXA.text: My 8 year old daughter saw an Indian cooking show and asked me to take her to an Indian restaurant. We chose this place based on its high ratings. The interior was pleasantly decorated and we were seated quickly. The regular menu was great but the children's menu was not. All the items on the children's menu are a la carte and cost $5 each. If you order chicken, you get only chicken, no sides.   We ordered garlic naan and ended up with onion naan. My daughter doesn't eat onions. My daughter ordered lemonade and we got some kind of spiced lemonade. The server did not warn us that it would be a nontraditional lemonade. It cost $5 which took us by surprise, especially since she didn't like it.   My food was fantastic, but the service was mediocre at best. Some ethnic restaurants do an awesome job of introducing kids to new types of foods. This one did not. Bravo to the kitchen for the great food. Not a bad option for adults, but don't bring kids here, or at least don't bring kids who are new to Indian food.

pFT8tj897ECQY65EVM9Bag.text: I love the lunch all you can eat. I can only do one round of this but it is so good. I was never really into Indian cuisine but thanks to this place I am now

dxNAr93jQIXEJTfooR6hIg.text: A bit disappointed with the service. Food was not exceptional but not terrible too. Naan was good but the stuff we ordered was ok. Was really looking forward based on great reviews but it did not live up to our expectations.

lQllcZcVzKpGfjfjuDUWtg.text: Great Indian food always with good service. We ate outside because the weather was nice and had a pleasant lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Garlic Naan
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb Curry

JwDiUXwXp4IO9qMFD9LbDw.text: Went to Marigold Maison last night for dinner...the first time there and WOW!!!, what amazing service!!  The Manager was wonderful...so welcoming, open and friendly...made us feel like our presence was appreciated and like we'd been there hundreds of times already.  The waiter we has was outstanding...explaining all the various menu items, very polite, warm & open...even suggesting some of his favorites to try.  His service was exceptional and highly attentive!  The food was FANTASTIC...LOVED every bite and still wanted more, even though we were too full for words!  We will ABSOLUTELY be back...it was beautiful, relaxing and great fun!!  A perfect dining experience!

Bz2J6eroGz0wJM38r7IBgQ.text: Seriously good indian food in valley. I love the lunch menu (Thali's) :)

wc4BdF-uWLFw3OamrDzD3A.text: Great experience and wonderful food. The management was welcoming and the service was exceptional. Great to have a place with a tandoor oven and the chicken tikka was very tasteful. Friend found out why the pork chops come highly recommended.

gnQBDUpBEl7AAriBaFttvA.text: Our experience was nothing like the ones mentioned below. We ordered chicken tikka masala, paneer tikka masala and dal makhani. The food taste was not good at all, to say the least, it didnt taste indian at all except the daal that was good but not dal makahni for sure. The gulab jamun was better left alone as we did.

hJYB_VKf5duWKs5Jqzr3Cg.text: The best Indian food in the valley . Pure heaven .If you don't try out these place you'll be missing out big time .

5PCprf_hkTt_QQ50NdtvWA.text: Disappointing...both my husband's vindaloo (ordered spicey) and my aloo gobi were insipid.  The chai was not hot and not very tasty. The naan was dry. It was noisey and not the place to dine if you want to enjoy dinner conversation. They automatically added 20% tip to tab. Service was fair .. The pappadam were good.  No kheer on the menu.  Won't go back.

fyzMg0X3xZGQIFmsjUWgCw.text: Really good Indian food, with some South Indian twists such as dosa appetizers, plus several chaat. The korma and vindaloo were especially good. The naan was perfect. The saag paneer was the only disappointment because it wasn't stewed spinach but spinach-infused cream sauce, so a bit bland in flavor and texture. You need reservations for dinner due to its popularity unless you come after 8:30pm.

hDd_fmX6_JIZpPazCbGp_w.text: Best Indian food in Phoenix! Consistently good food. Lamb Vindaloo, lamb masala and lamb curry are delicious.

rgaMhdK3c4ZeOONFBnZUiQ.text: Lamb vindaloo was very tender, good for southern style Indian but missed the mark on the heat.

Eua_Ex30BlBfMH7yOSY7mA.text: I cannot say enough good things about this food! My husband and I moved to Arizona a few years ago from Seattle. We love the weather but really miss good ethnic food. After trying  4 other Indian restaurants we ended up here...WOOT!  We have only had food delivered so I am unable to say what the premises look like but I can tell you that they make the best Saag Paneer we have every had.

vudLeg0qA9ucPE3__8GW0Q.text: Awesome! Great food, excellent service. They even gave us a mango smoothie on the house for our sleeping princess! Will be back for sure.

sISIWiJOypr6weM36Zeo-g.text: I moved to Phoenix a couple of months ago and have been looking out for Indian restaurants. Marigold is by far my favorite. Good fresh food and great service.

zx-Vm7eI5snqmqwMMhH8hA.text: Second time and another fantastic meal!  Authentic with wonderful service, recommend to anyone that truly enjoys Indian Cuisine!

K29Q6H9MVug0Vt2O0XQ9bg.text: My wife and I flipped a coin between Salty Sow (I've been there before and love it) and Marigold (a place I haven't been).  As soon as we walked up, there was no host to greet us. We wait a minute and a host seats us on the patio. Including us, there are 3 other parties on the patio: my family, a group of four, and another group of four.  The waiter was ignoring us while the other two parties had drinks and appetizers brought to their table. As we're sitting there waiting for service, I see this guy dressed in black hurry into the restaurant (the patio is next to the entrance). A few minutes later, he comes out introduces himself as our waiter.   I'm guessing that our original waiter knew that he gave us horrible service and shuffled us off to the second waiter.  After we ate, we had to wait another 10 minutes for the bill. There was no offer for dessert or post-dinner drinks.  I will say that the food is good. My lamb chops were actually really good. Just keep an expectation for weak customer service.

EyOEOcj5MsxfjohTFHe3Ew.text: I love the food and used to frequent this place quite often. This all changed last Friday when I ran into the manager Steven. He turned us away due to the fact that we didn't have reservations. When I suggested that we could sit outside his response was that it was too hot. Upon telling him that we don't mind he replied that he only had one bus boy. I will never understand why Steven was so adamant about turning us away but Marigold Maison has lost a loyal customer. Steven should not deal with customers as he does not have a single customer service bone in his body.

FHM1ZolBGK6Hds7sJIAF6w.text: I was craving samosa chaat,  found it here and a wonderful Shrimp Korma and Lamb Vindaloo! The food made my heart smile :)!

9AaJJ3sySzKcOgiIfC1bSw.text: This was our first time eating Indian food and the whole staff made us feel really great about trying new things and helping us along the way.  The food was AMAZING!  We ordered the Tikka Masala and the Fish of the day and they were both very flavorful and super tasty!  We also tried the garlic naan which was out of this world!  We liked it so much we signed up for the rewards program because we will definitely be coming back!  I would totally recommend this great restaurant!

qKHGWlg0Wqajb1n3Ihq4bw.text: What a wonderful place to find in Phoenix! I frequent the Marigold Maison in the Chicago area, so I knew it was a destination place to have a team business dinner while in Phoenix. The food is fabulous, the staff is willing to accommodate your needs and the price was right. The hand painted walls are a tasteful work of art.  Our group chose to order many dishes and taste them all.  This is a great recommendation because we had a taste of India feast.

ymxHXljjRByoETGmi7W1nA.text: Excellent food and service could use a little help and organization in the front of the house

vfPYsmQBhQ4fa1RZv40fQg.text: Delicious. What else can I say. The vegetarian Tikka Masala with cheese was incredible. If I could I would lick the sauce off that bowl. All the dishes we tried had incredible seasoning and flavor. Thanks you to Abraham for the great recommendations. we will be back soon for sure.

53AYaWFQ4wH83HkNzbcuOQ.text: Some dishes like the Medu vada and Chicken Makhani were quite good, the naans were crisp and filling and the service was helpful and attentive.   However, the Dosa was completely soggy. And the Sambar with the dosa was spiceless. The restaurant was kind enough to take it off the bill.   All in all, a bit disappointing but the manager has promised to improve- so will try and come back.

Tca8KvMYMgbmZnoaSpxW9g.text: I have to agree with the ratings so many have given.....  VERY good Indian food even if you are not a big Indian food person. I like Strong flavors and these did not disappoint, and yet were not that 'spicy'.  My better half who likes things much LESS spicy thought it was wonderful also.....   Will be back to try something different soon!!

UThAYbUsgCS04crtbEm15w.text: We met some new friends recently when we stayed at an AirBnB and they highly recommended this place for Indian food.  We arrived on a Saturday night at 6pm and was seated right away as a party of 4.  Ordered garlic naan which arrived hot and was very tasty.  We also had Samosas for appetizers and they were cooked perfectly.  My husband had the lamb chops and I had the tandoori chicken --- both were excellent and the accompanying rice was a generous portion.  We wanted to have dessert but were full from the generous portions of our dinners.  We will be back when we visit PHOENIX again!

lrmAnC5pEcISlL8AOXUbRw.text: Safe Indian brought to you by white hipsters.  The Thali dishes are good.  Solid but I prefer the cheaper prices, greater variety, and better portions at places like Indian Paradise or Indian Dehli Palace.

43papTXqG5q_pJHkDckMmQ.text: Pushpa! Pushpa! Pushpa! Super cute Indian auntie!! Her husband is the chef and they are SO passionate about their food. They provided a wonderful and authentic mom and pop feel.  Being new to Indian food, she was amazing at suggesting wonderful dishes!!  I went in with a friend a couple weeks ago and Chef Sunil came to the table, greeted us and gave us a very warm welcome.  Pushpa made wonderful food suggestions as well as some great wine pairings. We ordered a feast, including gol guppa, mango salad, chicken tikka masala, lamb chops, lamb saag and garlic naan.  I've been here a couple more times since then and their wild-caught salmon tikka masala and masala dosa (Indian crepes) are to die for. Chef Sunil mentioned they are the hardest thing on their menu to make, but he loves sharing a piece of his culture. I've also stopped by for happy hour and they have an AMAZING happy hour. I'm a fan!

Q5S_haeT6I3ym53wbc4lLg.text: Absolutely wonderful, the chicken Tikka is delicious and comes with plenty of tasty rice, so no need to order more, unless you want to share!  If you like spicy, make sure to order extra spicy as their seasoning is mellow, but so tender and tasty.   Get the garlic Naan, but plan on getting twice as much as you would normally order. The garlic is amazingly fresh, so you will thank me :)   Also, don't order through Yelp as they report an hour wait for everything, when popular items like Chicken Tikka are probably ready for you in 20 minutes.   The best way to share their Tikka or Tandoori is to get a nice bowl, put the rice in and pass around the entrees. Special tip, there's a Dickeys BBQ right next door with a Coca Cola Freestyle Machine, so you can get some great pop to quench your thirst.   Sometimes, I even get Dickeys Chicken and add it to the Masons Tikka... Amazing!

WgMNjLMix_yQvK6agTd1BA.text: came here on a Saturday night with the family and the food was nothing but exceptional. The spices and portions were great! The reason why I gave it 4 stores is because our server didn't seem very attentive to our table. She never smiled at us and never came and checked on us. There was another server who kept coming to refill our waters and asked us how everything was and she was super nice and more attentive to us than our actual sever!! All in all it was a great night with amazing food. Highly reccomend

WrU293KdMASTwO4HU57mVg.text: Wow. This place. First time we went the chef was trying out dishes and we had a few plates come out for us to test. They were all great. We also had a seafood special that was to die for.   We've been back many times and it hasn't disappointed.

LgtuAez7_gUKFS0B76JyHw.text: I give five stars for the freshness of the food and service. The food tastes great. The food spice was according to American standards and indian people can easily tolerate the spicy level. I will visit again to try the kabab/tandoori delicacies.

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Paneer tikka masala! Very fresh!

T1h4Zq9Vrzge9b3rJPdBmw.text: Expensive place. Quality is good most of the times. Thali is outrageously priced for nothing.

OEmGn3ztMp70Vz0Ow1BizQ.text: The space is extremely small. We walked in and were told they take reservations, but they were able to seat us.   They have authentic Punjabi cuisine. They are pricey but tasty. Their bread (naan) is really big and good! The service was slow but they were very busy, our waitress was nice. I did order hot tea and the mug had dirt on the rim which grossed me out a little.   Overall I like this place, but have to admit it's a little pricy.

2DWZ7V4a1hLwOCnhn5VTgw.text: The food was alright (except the dessert, which tasted like it had been frozen for too long, and was unevenly heated as though it had been microwaved). The service was good enough, but not outstanding. The place was clean, and the decor was not unpleasant (but it wasn't really very interesting either). All in all, it was ok, but the prices were higher than I would expect to pay for just ok. I've paid less for better elsewhere. From what I've been told, the prices are more reasonable at lunchtime.

qw0NjNL16OXKdhuIq465KQ.text: I've eaten here three times now.  The first time was maybe a year ago and good. This most recent visit since their expansion was disappointing.  The service started off very friendly, but then became inattentive and almost annoyed - never filling water glasses; long random times between food - even though we asked to not delay as we had a young one with us.   I've had Indian food in many cities to compare.  This food was relatively bland.  The dosa was like a soft pancake stuffed with potatoes - not the thin crispy version that is more typical.  Lassi was OK, but only available in  mango version.   The saag paneer was relatively good. The chicken tikka masala was OK, but surprisingly little chicken for a $16 dish.   Wine selection was good. Overall, food is OK, jut not quite authentic Indian.  I would call this Indian-style.  There are not many Indian restaurants in the area.   So, this place is good for a nice meal if you're in no rush and don't mind getting Phoenix version of Indian.   The pricing is expensive for what it is.

cdrcoHnFh5hjxHZ5LzF--w.text: Probably my favorite Indian joint around here. The food is consistently good. Not a lot of atmosphere but absolutely good food.

ws-_5XuXDdQJcAfAohRvdg.text: I do not have a whole lot of experience eating Indian food however tonight's dishes chosen at Marigold Maison must set a new standard in terms of quality, depth and complexity of flavors.  We ordered the seared eggplant and butter shrimp as appetizers and they were both incredible. The seared eggplant was like candy it was so good and melt in your mouth! The butter shrimp was succulent accompanied by its chipotle cream sauce.  As entree, we ordered the spicy chicken korma and it was delightful. Our server Abraham brought us three different kinds of chutneys which were a nice finishing touch.  The service was spot on and very attentive. Thank you Abraham and the chefs who prepared this most delicious memorable meal ! Will definitely go back!

Tnk4cqPsqF5pQGbPXccm0Q.text: We came in with a party of 10 and they were so accommodating. Jeffrey our waiter was amazing! Very attentive the food is always tasty and flavorful. Will def come back.

FE7_MpuY05P8ptqHKltGfg.text: I hate to leave a bad review because I love Indian food, but every time after I eat here I have digestive issues. I think it's too much sodium and processed Ingredients in their food. It taste good but it comes with a high price of bloating. This last time I noticed the taste of high amounts of sodium in the meal. So if they make this correction and I dont have extreme bloating after I would then recommend it.  Less processed ingredients to make it healthier and easier to digest! It's like eating the junk food if Indian restaurants

fWfPG-R6yEvyRTPcnj9jVA.text: Yum! This place is such a great value. This gem of restaurant is hip with a cool vibe. It offers excellent service and as a Vegan I was able to find ample items to indulge in! Plenty of spice and variety

wyLfeAtOR6k-zpm48zELnw.text: Majorly disappointed. I've had the luxury of spending a lot of time in India and absolutely love the food. While that doesn't make me an expert in Indian food, it makes me someone who really enjoys it. After moving to the area, finding an Indian restaurant was a top priority. Marigold Maison caught my attention because of the terrific reviews and the fact that they had two of my favorite dishes on the menu - masala dosa and aloo gobi.  I've been after my wife to try the place since we got here and she finally agreed to so I made us a reservation for Saturday night. We were seated at a two-top next to the wall around the kitchen. Not horrible, but a bit disappointing given we had made a reservation. We ordered glasses of wine and the masala dosa. When I travel to India, the masala dosa is my standard everyday breakfast. I absolutely adore them and couldn't wait for my wife to try it. The dosa served was thick - almost like a tortilla instead of the paper-thin crispy dosa I'm used to. The filling was bland and the whole thing looked like it was flattened. The highlight was the coconut chutney, but the dosa itself was not very good. To top it off, my wife's wine was flat. Clearly the bottle had been open for a while.  After the appetizer, we waited for literally 15 minutes (I looked at my phone) waiting for the entrees. This was while we watched the people who came in after us get their entrees. When the food finally arrived, it was a total letdown. The Chicken vindaloo contained dry, chewy chicken and the vindaloo's only flavor component was "spicy". The saag panner was probably the only highlight of the entire experience, and it gained that position by being average in a meal of below average. The aloo gobi, one of my favorite dishes, was flavorless, lacked potato (you know, the aloo in aloo gobi) and had diced tomato in it, which was a first.  The final slap in the face was a check for over $90 for a very sub-par meal and disappointing service  I really wish I had eaten in the place that the other reviewers seem to have eaten at. It sounds like a great place, but unfortunately that wasn't my experience. Super disappointed. I won't go back.

MlHzkKujGX0Gv9wgkfk7eA.text: This was my first time visiting this location. I heard about it through social media as it has received a good reputation for great Indian cuisine. We wanted to ensure we ordered a good variety in order to get a good feel for most flavors. The food itself is a 3 out of 5. The flavors were bland, and all three entrees had a similar curry base. If I was doing a blind test they would all taste the same to me. The rice was not fluffy and stuck together in large chunks. You can not choose spice levels. The dosa/crepe was not crispy like it should be, very soggy. I have had better Indian food in the valley this place isn't worth the hype. As far as service, I would rate it a 0 out of 5. I had reservations and two parties without one got seated before ours. The server forgot to give us plates, forgot to bring one of the drink orders, and forgot to bring out the appetizer. Several items we inquired about, he said were no longer on the menu?! What?! Was unapologetic and careless. I drove far to visit this location but definitely will not be planning a trip back. Mediocre at best.

HrBDBwtL7JifA6xZ4ImOKQ.text: This place will not disappoint you. Personally homemade Indian food is my favorite! but this place is pretty close to homemade flavors. They are attentive, during our meal the owner checked on us which makes it feel personal. My favorite dish to order is the chicken curry with Naan bread and for appetizer I recommend vegetarian samosas. Make sure you know your spices!   I didn't know about the all you can eat option for $15 but now that I know,I will be sure to go during lunch times 11:30 am to 2:30 pm. They do have happy hour but that is only if you are at the bar or patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken curry

ffL1UVtZgj6ngrr-2i30gA.text: Waited almost 15 minutes for anyone to come to the table.   Food was very mediocre and surprisingly tasteless.  Chicken tikka Marsala tasted like bland tomato soup.   Mint shrimp appetizer was tasteless.   Overall, a very mediocre experience.   By comparison, Jewel of the Crown in old town Scottsdale is superior in every way - service, atmosphere, taste and value.

ksyt2tgNOWs9Th6Al5druQ.text: I had been wanting to try Marigold Maison ever since two of my MD friends totally recommended it.  It is an attractive place with ample seating, however my concern is always the food--how good is it? We ordered chicken biryani and my old stand by, Chicken Vindaloo.  I figured if they do vindaloo sauce well, other sauces will be good too.  Maybe it's an assumption but I have found it to be True.  The chicken vindaloo was delicious with plenty of cooked potatoes which is signature to the dish.  I asked for a "7" on the spiciness scale and what I got was more of a 5 but my guess is that they are afraid of overdoing especially for people they don't know.   The chicken biryani was different than most we have experienced.  The mix of spices in that dish did not taste as good (to us) as the other biryani's we have had.  I would not order this again.  But I will tell you that they are super generous with their portions.   I noticed that they don't do the complementary papadum (lentil crackers) as most indian restaurants do.  Everything seems to be a la carte even the chutneys.   The service was lovely and attentive.   I would definitely go back for the vindaloo or to try out their lunch specials,

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Biryani
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vindaloo

sgS52gYLn07bDkHijFTMFw.text: The wine was great! The service was ok. We sat on the patio and when asking about the food the waitress was not as knowledgeable as expected.  The flavor profile is not as authentic as the other reviews led me to believe. I guess it could be a different region then other places I've gone.  They didn't ask what spicy level we wanted and it came out barely mild.  I ordered chicken makhani. It tasted like straight tumeric. The shrimp Tikka masala doesn't taste like anything we've ever had. The samosa Chaat has pico on it, and was served cold. I'm not sure why they put pico on it at all. But it being cold definitely was not good.  I'm disappointed at best and won't be trying this place again.

j2dyvS-PGPZA-8ZDsZlkRA.text: After driving around aimlessly for 30 minutes trying to decide where to go for dinner we ended up here and we were not disappointed. It's small but plenty of indoor and outdoor seating, being that it summer we opted for the indoor seating despite the shade and misters.  We started with the chicken tikka pakoras which were delicious. I ordered the chicken tikka for my entree and mu husband got the chicken Carrey and an order or naan. The naan was delicious dipped in his curry which had just the right amount of heat. The chicken tikka was flavorful and moist on a bed of peppers and onions. We also had a side of basmati rice.  The service was efficient and friendly. The restaurant itself was clean. Dinner for two came to just over $40. We look forward to going back and trying some of the other dishes.

Tjl8CNl-U25octs5VsCWcw.text: I was very impressed, the decor is standard and comfortable and the staff was extremely nice and helpful. We had a relatively large group for dinner, the only thing my partner and I started with was the hummus and it was very good. For my entree I got the Malai Kofta, vegetable dumplings with potato and cauliflower in a saffron sauce. The sauce was very good, rich and flavorful without being overpowering with just a hint of sweetness. It was served with basmati rice that was very good and stayed warm. I got the garlic naan on the side with cilantro, they hand stretch the bread and bake it to order.....when it comes to my naan it's every man for himself (I don't share) my partner had the lamb curry and said it was good he also got the naan stuffed with potatoes and peas (also delicious) glad our friends recommended will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Malai Kofta
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sign

qodzQSXKMr3s0yC7H5ZTpg.text: I have to admit I'm very picky when it comes to Indian food. However, I'm glad I tried Marigold. Very nice atmosphere with very friendly staff. Food was very good. They had happy hour which were about $1 cheaper than their regular menu.  Our waitress guided us in selecting few of popular dishes.  Their lamb curry was full of flavor and had enough sauce for our dipping pleasure with Roti.  Portions were big but my hubby had big appetite so we managed to clean all of our plates.  I would love to go try out their lunch buffet next time . The Taj Mahal beer was spot on with all the dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb curry
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Ragu
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Samosa Chaat

VbMmGrQkOxtPDDxzhP7MsQ.text: Really tasty and modern! Traditional Indian dishes but in a modern setting. I had the Kashmiri Korma, Tikka Masala And Makhani (Butter Sauce)- got them all with chicken. The garlic naan was delish! Very central located at Tatum and cactus. Great service.

r9_Y4IyLj0zKVaiHB9VUbw.text: Quick summary - Marigold Maison serves good to sometimes excellent Indian food, but the prices are a bit on the high side.  The restaurant is pleasant but not fancy and the servers do their job as well as you would expect in a neighborhood ethnic restaurant.  The menu is extensive and has a couple of items that you do not associate with Indian cooking, such as lamb chops and ribs.  However, it is pretty much the standard stuff, with the tikki malasa being a deserved standout.  The spinach with cheese dish, however, was overly minty and not quite so good.    The only real problem is that I don't want to spend $50 on two entrees and one Naan at an Indian restaurant, and so I will not be back.  That is more a problem for Marigold Maison that it is for me, however, as there are plenty of other choices.

RpKZOmRT7ivCOsJmDnz-QA.text: The food is horrible.. I ordered chicken makhni with garlic naan .. The food was without any taste and moreover cold .. Mosquitoes accompanied me with the worst atmosphere i ever saw in an Indian restaurant. Om bistro is much better than this . No recommendations..

WKDm9hP83aZ_umEH1nuGSA.text: I absolutely LOVE this restaurant! Not only is the food fresh and flavorful but the service is top notch! Jeffrey has been my waiter for 6 months and he is attentive and charming! I'm a foodie and I used to be a waitress so my expectations are high! Jeffrey and Marigold Maison NEVER disappoint!

NtGDyl5ghS47Bj1q-JQWJA.text: So, when this little place was small and awesome...I lived there. Now it's 2x bigger and I've been twice. I need to go again. However, the manager on duty last time looked more comfortable at Red Lobster. Clue time, this is True ethnic Indian...you shouldn't have a guy who looks like he's going to do my taxes running an Indian restaurant. Just saying.

ZGHJjRsMXOeU3BpGCnNXpw.text: Very authentic Indian food. My forensic and I shared the chicken tikka masala, mutter paneer, samosas, and garlic naan. Everything was flavorful and hefty. In fact, we both had enough for leftovers. I hadn't been to a traditional Indian restaurant and am happy I tried it. I will certainly be back, ready to try new dishes.

CVzgB9DpTQAQna8UEByyRA.text: I heard amazing things about this place and as a longtime lover of Indian food, was very excited to try it! I ordered the makhani with paneer, a dish I've had many times in NYC, Phoenix, etc. The dish came out looking beautifully presented, but I immediately noticed that the sauce was yellow instead of the orange/red traditionally associated with makhani. I asked our server, who was very attentive, why tomato and seemingly any spice whatsoever had been left out of my makhani dish. Our server, not realizing that the first ingredient listed on the menu under makhani was "tomato," said the dish didn't include tomato. The flavor was still interesting, but mostly tasted so bland that I would have thought it to be an Italian dish rather than Indian. The garlic naan, however, was DELICIOUS.

Dz0ZXNINDe6t62Yz8_1Swg.text: This is our first time visiting the restaurant, and we fell in love with the place,food, and service. Strating with the restaurant vibe when you walk in, the music and lights are taking you to India. We were welcomed by our lovely host Puspa, she took extra care of us and did amazing job.   The food is incredible, everything was perfect, the chicken Tikka was well flavored, the nan and poti were so delicious. The rice was fluffy and exotic. Definitely coming back

Pbz_p42IS25wTW4FzzsYhA.text: We were looking forward to the all you can eat lunch thali however our experience was very disappointing. When we entered the man was so upset to see us, no smile nothing. He got us seated but gave no table settings.   We noticed that they were heavily understaffed. The main dining area was full but there were just 2 servers. Our server was pleasant but couldn't get any orders on time. We waited 45 mins before our thali came.   They have a choice of vegetarian thali and Meat thali, each comes with naan, 3 types of curries, samosa, rice, dal, salad and rice pudding. Chicken, lamb and malai kofta was good, rest was just ok.  When our food finally came, we asked for table settings 3 times but no luck. I finally got up from my seat to get some.   They advertise it as all you can eat however nothing gets refilled. We asked for naan that never came. Waited another 30 mins but no naan. My husband wanted refill on lamb and chicken but that never came. So we just asked for our check and left.

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States

si8Dy43_lq8rknHh8juiXg.text: DO NOT GO! WORST INDIAN FOOD EVER!!  First the plates were dirty. Second the food was AWFUL! We ordered the butter chicken, saag paneer, garlic naan, and raita (yogurt).  The butter chicken was the only thing edible and the chicken was pregrilled sliced chicken!! Butter chicken is always made with tandoori chicken that is simmered in a butter tomato sauce and this was just so disappointing. The taste was just gross.   The saag paneer tasted so bad we couldn't even eat it.  Every person in my family has been here and I wish they had told me before I went because they all experienced similar dining experiences and would never go there again.  If you are looking for good Indian food, LOOK ELSEWHERE! Everything here is microwaved and served!

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mango lassi (not good)
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Probably the WORST Indian food I have ever eaten!!
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Butter chicken (awful)

Sjc6cFqRR-dMv1SQRvlyuA.text: Coming from Dallas which has millions of restaurants, I can bet that this has been the best Indian restaurant amongst all of them. Paneer Tikka Masala, Malai Kofta along with Garlic Rotis and Garlic Naans were the highlights ! Wah mazha aa Gaya :)

hF6q8Xx6Yzhya_sDFSPJ7Q.text: This place is nice clean and food is good as well. They keep less spices in every curry so anyone can try. Big seating area and super nice servers. Only problem is the delay when you ask for refill of curry or even order more naan. They take so much of time that 2 of our friends gave up for the wait. But servers were nice so they packed the refill things and gave to us. They are generous and courteous. Must try platter.

photos.caption: Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Marigold Maison- Paradise Valley - Phoenix, AZ, United States

GyFpOo63EHxNvhKiDk4nVA.text: We used to visit this place a lot a couple years back. We noticed a drop in the quality of food so we had not been back in sometime. We decided to take another shot and we were not disappointed.  Got a couple different items. The butter shrimp appetizer was delicious.  Our twin boys enjoyed the chicken tikka masala and rice. The garlic naan was super fresh an delicious.  The chicken biriyani was average which was the only downside.  We also got regular lassi which was awesome as well. Seems like the ambience was a lot more open and brighter as well.  Would recommend marigold if your in the mood for some Indian food in Scottsdale.
